title: 1992 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira
text:
The 1992 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira was the 14th edition of the <a href="Superta%C3%A7a%20C%C3%A2ndido%20de%20Oliveira">Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira</a>, the annual <a href="Portugal">Portuguese</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> season-opening match contested by the winners of the previous season's top <a href="Primeira%20Liga">league</a> and <a href="Ta%C3%A7a%20de%20Portugal">cup</a> competitions (or cup runner-up in case the league- and cup-winning club is the same). The 1992 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira was contested over two legs, and opposed <a href="Boavista%20F.C.">Boavista</a> and <a href="FC%20Porto">Porto</a> of the <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a>. Porto qualified for the SuperCup by winning the <a href="1991%E2%80%9392%20Primeira%20Divis%C3%A3o">1991–92 Primeira Divisão</a>, whilst Boavista qualified for the Supertaça by winning the <a href="1991%E2%80%9392%20Ta%C3%A7a%20de%20Portugal">1991–92 Taça de Portugal</a>.
The first leg which took place at the <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20das%20Antas">Estádio das Antas</a>, home of FC Porto, saw Boavista defeat Porto 2–1. The second leg which took place at the <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20do%20Bessa">Estádio do Bessa</a>, saw a 2–2 draw between both sides, with Boavista recovering from a 0–2 deficit in the last 10 minutes of the game, and thus allowed Boavista to win 4–3 on aggregate over two legs which would give the "Panteras" their second Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira after their first conquest in 1979, also against Porto, in the very first edition of the competition.
